Position Yourself to Come Out on Top in a Multiple-Offer Situation

 Mar 6, 2020

Mar 6, 2020

As a buyer in our Charlotte market, here’s how you can come out on top if you find yourself in a multiple-offer situation.

 

If a listed home is priced well, move-in ready, and in a good location, more than one buyer will see the value in it, hence multiple-offer situations. We’re in a seller’s market here in Charlotte and our economy is strong, which means we’re seeing many bidding wars break out over available homes. As a buyer, how can you position yourself in the best way possible so that you win out in a multiple-offer situation and close on the home you want? Mike Hege joins me today to answer that question by offering some valuable tips. 

Remember, if you have questions about this or any real estate topic, don’t hesitate to reach out to me. I’m here to help.

    Experience Exceeds Expectations… Scott enjoys creating “clients for life,” and building lasting relationship with his buyer and seller clients. In fact, his clients say it best: 75% of his business has come from client referrals and repeat business. He attributes his successes to loyal clientele and a consistent commitment to exceptional customer service standards. Scott says, “A satisfied client is not enough. It’s about constantly striving to produce results beyond the ordinary.” Scott has found new and unique ways to guide his clients through this constantly changing real estate market. He has developed an aggressive marketing plan to get listings sold, and has put together a team of top producing real estate agents who are leaders in the marketplace.
